page.title: 17THE VILLAGE OF SHREWTON
page.content: It is likely that the area around Shrewton and Orcheston has been inhabited for almost 3000 years. Stonehenge,which is 4 miles to the east,and numerous burial mounds are evidence to support this. The name Shrewton is derived from "Winterbourne Shreveton" which means "the sheriff's settlement by the winterbourne stream".In the late medieval times the name became Shrewton. The Hollow is a road in the village,its name has evolved from "Hlaew",meaning graveyard. Several years ago a sixth century Anglo-Saxon grave was excavated there and it is thought there are other such graves nearby. Mill House and Mill Lane remind us that there once was a windmill in the village.
